snippet.title: Nissan Leaf replaces Lance Armstrong with bear
snippet.description: A new TV ad for the Nissan Leaf, launching in Thursday's NFL season debut, offers the idea that polar bears, sad that their home is melting, want to thank humans for driving a Leaf.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong begs twitterati to find his bike
snippet.description: The one-of-a-kind time trial bike of the seven-time Tour de France winner was stolen. So he immediately reached out to his Twitter followers and even offered a reward.

snippet.title: AOL's Armstrong reverses cuts to 401(k), apologizes for comment
snippet.description: CEO Tim Armstrong announces the reversal of a recent policy to reduce the number of times AOL makes matching contributions to 401(k) plans.

snippet.title: $700 gadget for the next Lance Armstrong
snippet.description: It monitors your health and performance while cycling.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong launches health and fitness site, sort of
snippet.description: This post initially misstated the type of cancer Lance Armstrong survived. It was testicular.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong launches health and fitness site, sort of
snippet.description: Demand Media has launched Livestrong.com, dedicated to health and fitness knowledge and goal-setting, in conjunction with the champion cyclist.

snippet.title: Electric bike turns you into Lance Armstrong
snippet.description: Hybrid uses small motor to aid pedal power.

snippet.title: Moon dust gathered by Neil Armstrong discovered in warehouse after 40 years
snippet.description: While tidying up a storage space at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, an archivist makes a cosmic discovery.

snippet.title: Reply to Mr. Ohman concerning patent dispute with Lance Armstrong Foundation
snippet.description: Mr. Chris Ohman expressed concern about the facts presented in yesterday's posting concerning his dispute with the Lance Armstrong Foundation. This posting is directed to the concerns he raised.

snippet.title: Lance Armstrong Foundation sued by holder of design patent for BARKSTRONG pet collar
snippet.description: In an apparent retaliatory lawsuit, Chris Ohman has sued the Lance Armstrong Foundation ("LAF") for infringing a design patent to its "BARKSTRONG" dog collar design.
